comments.content:
It's not A because it says "any" users but we can see the user group is called "it". 

It's not B because it says access IT applications on all ports, it's not all ports, but default ports.

It's not D because it says group "DMZ" but the group is called "it".

It's C which says to allow group "it" to access IT application, which is true. If they added "on standard ports" would have been more accurate but then it would have been simple I assume

questions.question_text:
Based on the screenshot, what is the purpose of the group in User labelled `it`?
//IMG//

choices.C: Allow users in group ג€itג€ to access IT applications.
choices.D: Allow users in group ג€DMZג€ to access IT applications.
choices.B: Allows users to access IT applications on all ports.
choices.A: Allows ג€anyג€ users to access servers in the DMZ zone.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Drop doesn't send a response, NOT letting the bad guy know they were blocked
I think there is the same question , i dont remember the number , with B as the correct answer i am getting doubt about the effectiveness of this questions for help

questions.question_text: Which action results in the firewall blocking network traffic without notifying the sender?

choices.B: If it is an allow rule, then the Security policy rule is applied last.
choices.D: If it is an allowed rule, then the Security Profile action is applied last.
choices.A: If it is a block rule, then Security Profile action is applied last.
choices.C: If it is a block rule, then the Security policy rule action is applied last.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Security Profiles are added to the end of Security policy rules. After a packet has been allowed by the Security policy

comments.content: That is true, Security profiles are applied only after a Security policy allow match; if the traffic is for example dropped they will not match Security profiles.

questions.question_text:
Assume that traffic matches a Security policy rule but the attached Security Profiles is configured to block matching traffic.
Which statement accurately describes how the firewall will apply an action to matching traffic?

discussion.content: Antivirus Security Profiles protect against viruses, worms, and Trojans, along with spyware downloads.

questions.question_text: Which Security profile can you apply to protect against malware such as worms and Trojans?
